abstract: The move comes after the bank pumped money into the system for two days to ease fears of a liquidity crisis.
snippet: The move comes after the bank pumped money into the system for two days to ease fears of a liquidity crisis.
lead_paragraph: TOKYO, Tuesday, Aug. 14 (Dow Jones) — The Bank of Japan drained 600 billion yen ($5 billion) from the money supply Tuesday morning, after pumping money into the system for two days to ease fears of a liquidity crisis.

headline.main: In Reversal, Japan’s Central Bank Pulls Back $5 Billion
headline.print_headline: In Reversal, Japan’s Central Bank Pulls Back $5 Billion
